column1: Potter syndrome and Potter phenotype refers to a group of findings associated with a lack of amniotic fluid and kidney failure in an unborn infant.
The kidneys normally produce the amniotic fluid (as urine).
The pressure of the uterine wall leads to an unusual facial appearance, including widely separated eyes.
The following tests may be used to help diagnose the condition in a newborn: - X-ray of the abdomen - X-ray of the lungs
Treatment will be provided for any urinary outlet obstruction.
